ABSTRACT from Ferreira, Jorge Cesar, Inhibition Index of Methane Hydrate Formation: Development and Application . Thesis Supervisors: Professor Pierre MothÃ© Esteves, Ri o de Janeiro: UFRJ/IQ, 2020. Thesis (Doctor in Science). The present study introduces the conception and experimental evaluation of an index, which allows the quantification of the ability of molecules to inhibit methane hydrate formation. The inhibition index, I, is defined as I = ln(P Fi/PFH2O), where PFi and PFH2O are the final pressures (assumed as the equilibrium pressures) of a closed system at constant temperature (NVT) containing a known molarity of the inhibitor ( PFi) in an aqueous methane solution and the neat solution as blank/reference test ( PFH2O). The index was used in the study of the ability of some alcohols to inhibit methane hydrate formation and allowed the determination of structure -property relationships. The index correlation showed that the chain size and the number of hydroxyl groups prese nt in the molecule (mono, di and polyalcohols ) affect its ability to inhibit and an explanation for their mechanism of inhibition was proposed. The index also allowed to propose structural modifications of the inhibitors in order to improve its inhibitory power. A new water -soluble polymer derived fr om cardanol, which is a major component of cashew nutshell liquid, was appli ed as inhibitor and showed a good inhibition power, opening -up promising perspectives for its use in the gas and petroleum production industries.
Keyword: Methane hydrate, inhibition, Polyetherglycol, Thermodynamic inhibitor, Kinetic Inhibitor
